articles.author: Gram Slattery
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio said on Sunday the next few days will determine how serious Russian President Vladimir Putin is about peace in Ukraine, as U.S. officials fly out to Saudi Arabia for meetings with Russian officials.
articles.title: Rubio says coming days will show if Putin serious about Ukraine peace

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel has received a shipment of heavy MK-84 bombs from the United States, after U.S. President Donald Trump lifted a block imposed on the export of the munitions by the administration of predecessor Joe Biden, the defence ministry said on Sunday.
articles.title: Israel receives shipment of heavy bombs cleared by Trump

articles.author: Maha Dahan, Ahmed Rasheed
articles.description: Iraq's central bank will ban five more local banks from engaging in U.S. dollar transactions, a move that comes after meetings with U.S. Treasury officials in efforts to combat money laundering, dollar smuggling and other violations, two sources with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters on Sunday.
articles.title: Exclusive: Five Iraqi banks to be banned from U.S. dollar transactions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least one person was injured in Russian overnight air attacks that also started a fire in a critical infrastructure building in the southern city of Mykolaiv and damaged several houses in the Kyiv region, Ukrainian officials said on Sunday.
articles.title: Russian overnight attacks injure one, damage infrastructure, houses, Ukraine officials say

articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: Gone are the crowded arenas, the pulsing playlists, the off-the-cuff 90-minute campaign speeches. Now that Donald Trump is back in the White House, he is favoring a new style of communication with the American public – almost-daily appearances direct from the Oval Office.
articles.title: Donald Trump: Coming to you almost daily from the Oval Office

articles.author: John Irish
articles.description: The United States has asked its European allies what they would need from Washington to participate in Ukraine security arrangements, according to a document seen by Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: US asks Europeans what they need for Ukraine security guarantees

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Middle envoy Steve Witkoff said on Sunday that talks on phase two of a ceasefire deal between Israel and Palestinian militants Hamas would continue this week "at a location to be determined" to figure out how to reach a successful conclusion.
articles.title: US Mideast envoy says phase two Gaza talks to continue this week

articles.author: Andrew Gray, John Irish, Lili Bayer
articles.description: Europe's leaders fear that they can no longer be sure of U.S. military protection and that Donald Trump will do a Ukraine peace deal with Vladimir Putin that undermines Kyiv and broader European security.
articles.title: Shocked Europeans play catch-up after Trump moves on Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's military on Monday condemned the sailing of a Canadian warship in the Taiwan Strait, saying its air and naval forces had monitored and warned the ship.
articles.title: China condemns sailing of Canadian warship in Taiwan Strait

articles.author: Timothy Gardner
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump and his adviser Elon Musk purged less than 50 workers from the agency that maintains the country's nuclear weapons arsenal, the Department of Energy said on Sunday, after far wider layoffs there were suddenly rescinded, causing chaos among staff.
articles.title: US energy department says less than 50 purged from nuclear security office
